case_vignette: A 34-year-old woman arrives to your office complaining of a recurrent rash. The first time the patient noticed the rash was after going in the water at the beach six weeks ago. She reports that since then, she has developed similar appearing pink and itchy rashes on her arms and legs. She states that the rashes eventually resolve on their own. The patient works as a forest ranger at a national park. Her medical history is significant for systemic lupus erythematous and asthma. Her current medications include NSAIDS and an albuterol inhaler. She reports that she has seasonal allergies but no food intolerances. Her temperature is 98°F (36.7°C), pulse is 70/min, blood pressure is 118/77 mmHg, respirations are 13/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. Upon physical examination, you appreciate diffuse, mild expiratory wheezes. There is no evidence of airway obstruction. When ice is placed on her leg, a rash appears, as pictured in Figure A.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I keep getting a pink, itchy rash on my arms and legs that comes and goes.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as redness, swelling, or pain?
No, just the itchy pink rashes.
Have you had any recent injuries or cuts on your arms and legs?
No, I haven't had any recent injuries or cuts.
Have you been taking any medications or supplements recently?
I've been taking NSAIDs and using an albuterol inhaler.
Have you had any allergies or skin conditions in the past?
I have seasonal allergies but no food intolerances.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin's texture or appearance?
No changes in texture, just the recurring pink rash.
Have you noticed any changes in your weight or appetite?
No, there haven't been any changes in my weight or appetite.
Have you noticed any changes in your sleep patterns or energy levels?
No, my sleep patterns and energy levels have stayed the same.
Have you noticed any changes in your mood or emotional state?
No, my mood and emotional state have been normal.
Have you noticed any changes in your menstrual cycle or sexual activity?
I haven't mentioned any changes in my menstrual cycle or sexual activity.
Have you noticed any changes in your family history of skin conditions or allergies?
I haven't mentioned any family history of skin conditions or allergies.
Final Diagnosis: Atopic Dermatitis.
